headline: Nvidia chip shift to smartphone-style memory to double server-memory prices by end-2026 - Counterpoint
summary: BEIJING (Reuters) -Nvidia's move to use smartphone-style memory chips in its artificial intelligence servers could cause server-memory prices ​to double by late 2026, according to a report published on Wednesday by ‌Counterpoint Research.  In the past two months, electronics supply chains around the world have been hit by a shortage ‌of legacy memory chips as manufacturers turned their focus to high-end memory chips suited to semiconductors designed for AI applications.  Nvidia recently decided to reduce AI server power costs by ⁠changing the kind of memory chip ‌it uses to LPDDR, a type of low-power memory chip normally found in phones and tablets, from DDR5, which are typically ‍used in servers.

Nvidia recently decided to reduce AI server power costs by ⁠changing the kind of memory chip ‌it uses to LPDDR, a type of low-power memory chip normally found in phones and tablets, from DDR5, which are typically ‍used in servers.

headline: Bear of the Day: Entegris (ENTG)
summary: Semiconductor-related stocks have taken the brunt of the pullback in correlation with AI bubble fears, and Entegris (ENTG) has been one to avoid in particular.

content.title: Bear of the Day: Entegris (ENTG)

headline: AI Chips Update - Europe Advances AI with France's First Exascale Supercomputer
summary: AMD and Eviden have been selected to construct Alice Recoque, Europe's second and France's first Exascale supercomputer, which will significantly enhance the region’s AI and scientific computing capabilities. Powered by next-generation AMD CPUs and GPUs, the project underscores a joint European effort to support high performance computing and AI applications with a commitment to energy efficiency. This initiative, with a budget of 544 million euros, represents a significant investment in...
